verse.roman:
tataḥ sapatnaṁ mukhataś
carantam akuto-bhayam
jaghānotpatya gadayā
hanāv asuram akṣajaḥ

synonyms: tataḥ—then; sapatnam—enemy; mukhataḥ—in front of Him; carantam—stalking; akutaḥ-bhayam—fearlessly; jaghāna—struck; utpatya—after springing up; gadayā—with His mace; hanau—at the chin; asuram—the demon; akṣa-jaḥ—the Lord, who was born from the nostril of Brahmā.
translation: The Lord, who had appeared from the nostril of Brahmā, sprang and aimed His mace at the chin of His enemy, the Hiraṇyākṣa demon, who was stalking fearlessly before Him.
